alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 7:54PM PDT until May 23 at 4:38PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Flood Warnings continue for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. Minor flooding is forecast for both rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MAY 23RD... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stehekin River at Stehekin. * WHEN...Until Tuesday May 23rd. * IMPACTS...At 24.3 feet, The river may be out of its banks in spots on parts of Stehekin Valley Road and Company Creek Road, especially from Harlequin Bridge to about seven miles upstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 24.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM PDT Tuesday was 24.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with an expected maximum value of 25.9 feet late Friday evening. It is forecast to fall below flood stage by May 23rd. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.9 feet on 05/30/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday afternoon at 515 PM PDT.
